subject: Public Speaking
title: The Ethics of Persuasion
description: A quick win: understand The Ethics of Persuasion.

hook.text: Every persuasion technique in this course can be used for good or evil. The tool doesn't choose â€” the speaker does.

buildup.text: Quintilian argued the ideal orator is a good person speaking well. Machiavelli argued results are all that matter.

discovery.text: Modern ethics suggest a middle path: persuasion is ethical when it respects the audience's autonomy and dignity.

twist.text: Even well-intentioned persuasion can cross lines. Health campaigns that shame smokers save lives but erode dignity.

climax.text: The ethical test: Would you be comfortable if your audience knew exactly what techniques you were using and why?

punchline.text: Persuade as if the audience can see your playbook.

quiz.question: What is the ethical test for persuasion suggested in this topic?
options: Would you be comfortable if your audience knew your techniques?
